Projekt SRIPT odnesel direktorico Turistično gostinske zbornice Slovenije
05 Nov 2019, 13:55 by STA

Potem ko je gospodarsko ministrstvo prejšnji teden okrožnemu državnemu tožilstvu v Ljubljani naznanilo sum kaznivih dejanj pri projektu SRIPT, je upravni odbor Turistično gostinske zbornice Slovenije danes razrešil direktorico zbornice Klavdijo Perger. Za v. d. direktorja je imenoval Fedjo Pobegajla.



Upravni odbor Turistično gostinske zbornice Slovenije je danes razrešil direktorico zbornice Klavdijo Perger. Foto: STA

LJUBLJANA > Turistično gostinska zbornica Slovenije je projekt Strateško razvojno inovacijsko partnerstvo Turizem (SRIPT) prijavila na razpis gospodarskega ministrstva za podporo strateškim razvojno inovacijskim partnerstvom. Ministrstvo je z njo aprila 2018 sklenilo pogodbo o sofinanciranju, na podlagi katere je prejela 390.000 evrov iz Evropskega sklada za regionalni razvoj.
Junija letos pa je ministrstvo pri preverjanju izpolnjevanja pogodbe o sofinanciranju projekta zaznalo okoliščine, na podlagi katerih je pred kratkim zoper zbornico, njeno direktorico in še dve fizični osebi vložilo naznanitev suma kaznivih dejanj goljufije, goljufije na škodo EU in ponarejanja listin. Zadržalo je tudi izplačilo tretjega dela druge faze projekta SRIPT, zaradi česar je upravni odbor septembra naročil izredno revizijo izvajanja tega projekta.
Na podlagi preliminarnih ugotovitev revizorjev družbe Deloitte je upravni odbor zbornice na dopisni seji 25. oktobra Klavdijo Perger razrešil z mesta koordinatorke projekta SRIPT in na to mesto začasno imenoval Dimitrija Picigo.
Danes pa so se člani upravnega odbora sestali še na izredni seji in se seznanili s končnim poročilom revizije tega projekta. Ob tem so soglasno sklenili razrešiti Pergerjevo tudi s položaja direktorice zbornice, na njeno mesto pa začasno imenovati Fedjo Pobegajla, so sporočili iz Turistično gostinske zbornice Slovenije. Pobegajlo je dolgoletni turistični delavec in bivši član upravnega odbora zbornice.
Na Turistično gostinski zbornici Slovenije poudarjajo, da je projekt SRIPT tako za zbornico kot za slovenski turizem strateškega pomena. Gre namreč za prvi projekt v slovenskem turizmu, ki je vanj umestil funkcijo raziskav in razvoja ter tako dvignil dodano vrednost v panogi ter prvič začel z interdisciplinarnim povezovanjem med različnimi panogami.
V projektu, ki se nadaljuje tudi v prihodnje, sodeluje veliko število gospodarskih subjektov, izpeljanih je bilo veliko uspešnih aktivnosti. Na podlagi posameznih nepravilnosti so že bili sprejeti nekateri interni ukrepi, poleg tega se bo z imenovanjem novega v. d. direktorja zbornice in novega koordinatorja projekta SRIPT zagotovilo, da v prihodnje ne bo prihajalo do nepravilnosti, še pravijo na zbornici.

The SRIPT project takes away the director of the Slovenian Chamber of Tourism and Hospitality
05 Nov 2019, 12:55 by STA

Last week, after the Ministry of Economy had announced to the District Attorney's Office in Ljubljana the suspicion of crimes in the SRIPT project, the director of the Chamber of Tourism and Hospitality of Slovenia dismissed today the director of the Chamber, Claudia Perger. For v. d. he named Fedjo Pobegajl as director.



The Board of Directors of the Slovenian Tourist Board has today dismissed the director of the Chamber, Claudia Perger. Photo: STA

LJUBLJANA> The Tourism and Hospitality Chamber of Slovenia has submitted the Strategic Development Innovation Partnership Tourism (SRIPT) project to a call from the Ministry of Economy to support strategic development innovation partnerships. The Ministry signed a co-financing contract with it in April 2018, on the basis of which it received EUR 390,000 from the European Regional Development Fund.
However, in June this year, the ministry found, in a review of the fulfillment of the project co-financing contract, the circumstances under which it recently filed a criminal complaint against the Chamber, its director and two other individuals on the grounds of fraud, fraud to the detriment of the EU and falsification of documents. It also withheld the payment of the third part of the second phase of the SRIPT project, which prompted the Governing Board to order an extraordinary review of the implementation of this project in September.
Based on the preliminary findings of Deloitte's auditors, Claudia Perger was dismissed from her position as the coordinator of the SRIPT project by a Board of Directors meeting at a correspondence meeting on 25 October and appointed Dimitrij Picigo to that post.
Today, however, the members of the board of directors met in extraordinary session and were briefed on the final audit report of this project. At the same time, they unanimously decided to dismiss Perger from the position of the director of the chamber, and in her place temporarily appoint Fedja Pobegajla, the Tourist and Tourism Chamber of Slovenia announced. The longtime tourism worker and former board member of the Chamber escaped.
The Slovenian Chamber of Tourism and Food emphasize that the SRIPT project is of strategic importance for both the Chamber and Slovenian tourism. This is the first project in Slovenian tourism that has placed the R&D function in it, thus raising the added value in the industry and for the first time started interdisciplinary integration between different industries.
The project, which continues in the future, involves a large number of economic operators, and many successful activities have been carried out. On the basis of individual irregularities, some internal measures have already been taken, and the appointment of a new one in. d. The Chamber's director and the new SRIPT project coordinator are assured that no irregularities will occur in the future, the chamber said.
